thread.title: A look at the next round of state softball playoffs
thread.title_full: A look at the next round of state softball playoffs

author: Nicole Saavedra
title: A look at the next round of state softball playoffs
text:
A look at the next round of state softball playoffs By Nicole Saavedra updated Tuesday, October 20, 2015 - 10:59pm close Prince Avenue Christian still tops in football Power Ratings 
Three area teams advanced to the second round of the state softball tournament, and two more open their postseason runs today. 
East Jackson, Oconee County and North Oconee posted wins in their opening playoff series last week. Athens Christian and Prince Avenue Christian begin play in the Class Private playoffs today. 
A third game will be played Thursday if needed. 
Here’s a closer look at the matchups featuring Athens-area teams: 
Class A Private 
Fellowship Christian at Prince Avenue Christian, 2 p.m.: Fellowship Christian (12-11) is on a four-game losing skid, and hasn’t scored a run since Oct. 8. Prince Avenue Christian (17-7) outscored opponents 30-3 in its last three games. 
Athens Christian at Tattnall Square, 5 p.m.: Athens Christian (17-12) is 3-3 on the road this season. Tattnall Square (23-5) is 1-2 this month, including a 4-1 loss to Eagle’s Landing Christian and a 5-0 loss to Georgia Military College. 
Class AAA 
Oconee County at Blessed Trinity, 2 p.m.: Oconee County (15-15) outscored Pepperell 20-7 in a sweep in the first round. Blessed Trinity (22-10) is 5-0 this month, including an 8-6 win in extra innings in Game 2 against Southeast Bulloch. 
East Jackson at Pierce County, 5 p.m.: East Jackson (23-10) needed extra innings in both games to slip past Cedartown in the first round. Pierce County (26-3) scored 18 and 11 runs in routs of Cedar Grove. 
Class AAAA 
North Oconee at Eastside, 5 p.m.: North Oconee (18-15) scored seven runs in each of its wins over Carrollton last week. It’s the most the Titans have scored since an 8-0 win over Chestatee on Sept. 15. Eastside (21-11) is 9-2 since snapping a five-game losing streak in August.
